10:53 <vmassol> good morning  
10:53 <vmassol> release day! :)  
10:55 <lucaa> has quit  
11:01 <vmassol> seems XE is broken: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-administration-test-tests/4721/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.administration.test.ui/AdministrationTest/verifyGlobalAndSpaceSections/  
11:02 <vmassol> the registration  
11:02 <vmassol> seems cjd broke it  
11:02 <vmassol> it broke in that build: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/4721/  
11:02 <vmassol> (which was triggered by cjd commits)  
11:03 <vmassol> cjd: can you have a quick look please, we need to release today and it's been broken since the 6th...  
11:03 <vmassol> (it says a lot about us monitoring our build… )  
11:03 <Denis> has quit  
11:05 <cjd> I saw it break but I couldn't be sure if it was me because a zillion things broke, mostly crypto  
11:06 <vmassol> no crypto was only yesterday  
11:06 <vmassol> this broke on the 6th  
11:06 <vmassol> and it's still broken  
11:07 <vmassol> for ex: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-administration-test-tests/4727/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.administration.test.ui/AdministrationTest/verifyGlobalAndSpaceSections/  
11:07 <vmassol> basically there's a velocity error on a page  
11:07 <vmassol> which means that you probably made a change but didn't really test it in a live instance :)  
11:08 <vmassol> the page is XWiki.Registration  
11:08 <cjd> mm in this case I could have done that  
11:08 <cjd> I never think of testing on a live machine because it usually requires a 6 hour build  
11:09 <vmassol> that's not true  
11:09 <vmassol> I do that several times per day  
11:09 <vmassol> and it takes 10mn max  
11:09 <vmassol> usually 30sec  
11:09 <vmassol> but 10mn if I need to rebuild all XE  
11:10 <cjd> 5.4 snap?  
11:10 <vmassol> and if you download a XE zip it takes about 5mn  
11:10 <vmassol> then you can execute it and import your modified page for ex  
11:10 <vmassol> if it's a jar you can copy it to WEB-INF/lib  
11:11 <vmassol> and then you always have an XE instance around to test so you usually don't need to redownload, especially to test a page change  
11:11 <vmassol> it's not as bad as 6 hours :)  
11:11 <cjd> yeah, I just have a short attention span, if something takes more than a couple minutes I switch to something else  
11:12 <cjd> cjdns was written while xwiki compiled ;)  
11:12 <vmassol> so you prefer to take other people's time  
11:12 <vmassol> nice  
11:12 <vmassol> :)  
11:12 <cjd> that's why I try to avoid core dev  
11:12 <vmassol> your 5mn has now taken 15mn of both our time  
11:12 <vmassol> + the 15 you'll need more to fix the problem and the 6 hours jenkins will require to rebuild all ;)  
11:13 <vmassol> overall not a good choice!  
11:13 <vmassol> what you're saying is that you prefer to code small libs, we all do, it's much simpler  
11:13 <cjd> yup  
11:13 <cjd> and by knitting together small libs, you can make other small libs  
11:14 <vmassol> yes xwiki  
11:14 <vmassol> it's made of 100 of other libs knit together  
11:14 <cjd> global variables break this a bit  
11:22 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: do I need to merge in 5.3?  
11:22 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: yes  
11:26 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <cjd> I'm reasonably sure this is not me  
11:28 <vmassol> XWiki.Registration is working fine?  
11:28 <cjd> yeah, I registered a user  
11:28 <cjd> and http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-administration-test-tests/4721/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.administration.test.ui/AdministrationTest/verifyGlobalAndSpaceSections/ is something else  
11:29 <cjd> and the text it's looking for in the test does seem to exist in my instance  
11:29 <cjd> the change I made is so fantastically small, the only thing I could imagine it affecting is invitation  
11:30 <cjd> just confirmed adding a user via the admin interface as well  
11:38 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:09 <evalica1> has quit  
12:18 <lucaa> has quit  
12:34 <cjd> Is there a Role I can implement to create a component which will be started up at xwiki's initialization?  
12:35 <vmassol> no  
12:35 <cjd> that's a bit unfortunate  
12:35 <vmassol> ATM the only solution is to listent to ApplicationStartedEvent  
12:36 <cjd> err  
12:36 <cjd> how do you attach the listener?  
12:36 <vmassol> you implement EventListener  
12:36 <cjd> oh and you'll be registered automatically by the annotation loader?  
12:37 <vmassol> all components are registered through the annotation loader yes  
12:37 <vmassol> (at startup)  
12:37 <vmassol> registered is not the same as instantiated though  
12:37 <vmassol> annotation loader will register  
12:37 <vmassol> ObservationManager will instantiate eventlisteners by looking them up  
12:38 <vmassol> OM is explicitely called in XWikiServletContextListener  
12:38 <cjd> ahh so I can use EventListener as a @Role ?  
12:38 <vmassol> (called = looked up + called)  
12:38 <vmassol> if you need to listen to events yes  
12:39 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:39 <cjd> @Component public Cjd implements EventListener, Initializable {    public void initialize() { System.out.println("hello world"); } }  
12:39 <cjd> works?  
12:39 <vmassol> no  
12:39 <vmassol> you'll need to impement getEvnets, getName and onEvent  
12:40 <cjd> ahh, of course  
12:40 <cjd> so if I implement onEvent I will get the event even though nothing explicitly called     observation.registerEvent()  
12:40 <cjd> \*registerEventListener() ?  
12:41 <vmassol> if you implement the EventListener role you'll get called when an event matching your getEvents() appears  
12:41 <cjd> ok cool  
12:41 <vmassol> (you'll get called = your onEvent() method)  
12:43 <vmassol> basically ATM if you need to not lazily instantiate a component you'll need to go through a kind of factory pattern, the factory being an EventListener  
12:43 <vmassol> said differently, our default is to lazily instantiate components ATM  
12:44 <vmassol> and whenever a module requires explicit init at startup time it implements an EventListener listening to ApplicationStartedEvent  
12:44 <cjd> yeah, I'm playing with a virt.x extension idea so that websocket related stuff doesn't have to be pulling teeth  
12:44 <vmassol> you can check the source code we have several  
12:44 <cjd> so virt.x needs to startup at the beginning  
12:45 <vmassol> 11 to be precise  
12:45 <vmassol> actually 10  
12:46 <vmassol> ExtensionApplicationStartedListener is an example of a listener there just to initialize another component at startup  
12:49 <sburjan> vmassol: any ideea if tmortagne will be available today ?  
12:49 <camil7> btw: just upgraded an existing test wiki to 5.0.3, and getting lots of exceptions from the solr indexer: "multiple values encountered for non multiValued field class". I guess this is just me messing up my test instance, however  
12:49 <camil7> er, upgraded from 5.0.3 to 5.3-rc-1 :-/ sorry  
12:50 <cjd> ooo thankyou very much  
12:56 <vmassol> camil7: I think you need to remove your solr index  
12:56 <vmassol> and restart xwiki  
12:57 <vmassol> I don't know what mflorea planned to do for this, we talked about a migration to remove the solr index among other things  
12:57 <vmassol> s/planned/is planning  
12:57 <vmassol> mflorea: is it in the release notes ATM?  
13:02 <camil7> vmassol: ah, ok, thanks, I just reindexed and thought that would fix the issue, but it didnt. now trying with the remove ...  
13:04 <camil7> yes, removing the index from disk fixes this :)  
13:08 <vmassol> ok cool  
13:19 <mflorea> vmassol, camil7: no automatic migration (i.e. removal of solr index) for the moment (not in 5.3 for sure). See http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki53RC1#HSolrSearchIndex  
13:20 <vmassol> mflorea: maybe we can be more precise in the RN about " If you upgrade from a recent version"  
13:21 <vmassol> we need to find the first release introducing Solr right?  
13:21 <mflorea> yep  
13:21 <vmassol> ok so we can say:  
13:21 <vmassol> "if you 've been using Solr"  
13:21 <mflorea> not good  
13:22 <vmassol> what cases does it miss?  
13:22 <mflorea> because they may switch to sorl after the upgrade and it wouldn't work  
13:22 <vmassol> oh  
13:22 <mflorea> even if they didn't use solr, the idex was created  
13:22 <vmassol> indeed solr is used even if you don't use it in the UI  
13:22 <mflorea> yep  
13:22 <vmassol> ok so since the first release where we had solr  
13:22 <mflorea> yep  
13:23 <vmassol> that's quite a lot of releases back  
13:23 <vmassol> 4.x  
13:23 <vmassol> 4.3  
13:23 <vmassol> 4.3M2 precisely  
13:23 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki43M2  
13:24 <vmassol> first time it appears in the RN I believe  
13:25 <mflorea> seems so, so we can say 4.3  
13:25 <vmassol> mflorea: let me know if my change is ok  
13:25 <vmassol> better be precise  
13:25 <mflorea> yep, thanks, look good  
13:25 <vmassol> ok cool

16:23 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
16:24 <evalica> has quit  
16:24 <vmassol> creating XAFORUM jira project  
16:25 <Kaisen> Hello, I have maybe a stupid question. But is it possible to link two xwiki instances which are running on two different server? Or maybe something like that a special subwiki is running on a separated server?  
16:26 <vmassol> interwiki links maybe  
16:27 <vmassol> not sure what you mean by "link"  
16:27 <vmassol> (Kaisen)  
16:30 <Kaisen> Idea behind is - I have a interla xwiki and I want a second which is accassable from external. But if I use the internal it can search in the external and I have access to it. But if I use the external one I cannot go on the internal one.  
16:35 <Kaisen> Or in other words. If I have for example a developer xwiki and I want to use xwiki also for other users but I don't want that it is possible that normal users have access to the developer one but also the developer should not need to jump from one to the other wiki  
16:35 <vmassol> you've lost me but in short, no 2 instances are separate  
16:35 <vmassol> but xwiki is multitenant by default  
16:36 <Kaisen> Yes I know  
16:36 <vmassol> and you can access data from one wiki to another using the REST api or using interwiki links  
16:36 <vmassol> Kaisen: you should use a single isntance and 2 subwikis and play with rights  
16:38 <Kaisen> Nothing against your software but if something went wrong than they have access to each other.  
16:38 <Kaisen> As the data on the same server if someone hack it he have also access to the other subwiki  
16:39 <vmassol> sure but looks very overkill, in any case it doesn' exist  
16:39 <Kaisen> But it is ok. You gave me the anser I'm looking for  
16:39 <vmassol> we had a project called P2P wiki in the past  
16:39 <vmassol> aka concerto  
16:39 <vmassol> http://concerto.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
16:39 <vmassol> but it stayed at a research level  
16:40 <Kaisen> Ok.  
16:40 <vmassol> also at http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+Concerto  
16:40 <Kaisen> The Background is that I want to push xwiki in our company  
16:40 <vmassol> yes that's a better link actually  
16:40 <vmassol> source code is still there in case you're interesting in contributing to that to bring it back to life :)  
16:41 <Kaisen> Problem is that we are a small IT department with no programming skills  
16:41 <vmassol> ok then it's going to be hard indeed :)  
16:41 <cjd> XWiki has features, features make attack surface.. if you're running a public facing page for a bank, you use the fewest lines of code possible and keep the JVM as far away from it as you can ;)  
16:41 <cjd> but if you need features, that's not an option  
16:42 <vmassol> that's complete bullshot  
16:42 <vmassol> all banks use java  
16:42 <cjd> yeah, you're right  
16:42 <vmassol> i know I participated to a lot of java designs for major banks in France  
16:42 <vmassol> :)  
16:42 <vmassol> for 10 years  
16:42 <Kaisen> What I want is to start with a internal xwiki instance for all our internal stuff  
16:42 <cjd> it's actually the bitcoin guys who have to worry because they can't just yank back a transfer :)  
16:43 <Kaisen> but we also have a lot of customers where we could use also xwiki to collaborate with them  
16:43 <Kaisen> But I want to prevent that a customer can access our internal stuff  
16:43 <Kaisen> so the idea is to use two xwikis  
16:43 <cjd> 2 JVMs on 2 real VMs  
16:43 <cjd> is how I'd approach it  
16:44 <Kaisen> but if I than search something i need to do it in both to check if there is already a page/info  
16:44 <vmassol> Kaisen: for search it's easy  
16:44 <vmassol> (I should say, shoudl be easy, I've never tried it :))  
16:44 <cjd> people on the inside wiki can search the one on the outside but not vice versa?  
16:45 <vmassol> you can configure xwiki's SOLR search to use a separate solr search instance  
16:45 <vmassol> not sure how our UI handles that though  
16:46 <vmassol> ( http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8442 fyi)  
16:47 <cjd> oh vmassol, you'll love this story.. there were some high freq trade companies who wanted to use a java based platform, they ended up putting a few hundred k into development before they actually put it under load, it worked excellently until the GC kicked in and they started violating their SLAs  
16:48 <cjd> so they ended up rewriting the GC and then they rewrote all of the structures in the program so they would collect faster  
16:48 <cjd> basically they write in in c.java  
16:48 <cjd> \*wrote  
16:51 <Kaisen> @ vmassol  If I get the Jira ticket right it is already imlemented and I can use it?  
16:51 <vmassol> Kaisen: yes  
16:51 <vmassol> but I don't thin it's been tested so you'd be the first guinea pig  
16:51 <vmassol> \*think  
16:51 <vmassol> :)  
17:03 <Kaisen> Just read the short docu. If I understood it right I can just put the search extern but not that a search give results of to xwikis.  
17:04 <vmassol> I don't know but you're probably right  
17:04 <vmassol> mflorea: ?  
17:04 <Kaisen> What I need is something like a google search internally which checks both xwiki instance and I don't give the external access to that search - only to there internal xwiki search which have no access to the other  
17:04 <vmassol> cjd: build is still failing… :(  
17:05 <vmassol> looking at it now, too bad you couldn't help  
17:06 <cjd> has quit  
17:09 <jtafurth> is now known as <jtafurth|away>  
17:12 <vrachieru> has quit  
17:15 <vmassol> ok the result is that caleb broke it  
17:15 <vmassol> :(  
17:16 <vmassol> pretty easy to see: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/c76dd5b5e84f43395a14f82b907b4508f90526c8#diff-0  
17:16 <vmassol> grrrr  
17:16 <camil7> strange, I could not reproduce the problem ... at least not in the jetty-test instance locally :-/  
17:16 <vmassol> he added an #if without adding an #end  
17:17 <vmassol> actuallty the other way around  
17:17 <vmassol> removed an #if without removing the #end  
17:17 <vmassol> fixing  
17:19 <vmassol> he also didn't update the comment...  
17:21 <vmassol> hmmm I think he committed only on master too  
17:21 <vmassol> but he said it was fixed in 5.3  
17:22 <vmassol> I'll fix jira only ATM  
17:24 <vmassol> hmm the #if is not on 5.3 branch  
17:24 <vmassol> and the #end is not there too  
17:24 <vmassol> I don't get it  
17:25 <vmassol> wait  
17:25 <vmassol> my bad  
17:26 <vmassol> no it's ok, it's not on 5.3  
17:28 <vmassol> I hope it's ok now  
17:28 <vmassol> need to go for 30mn, bbl

21:33 <maxr\_> Hi everyone. Is there a documentation to create a new WYSIWYG Editor plugin ?  
21:34 <vmassol> maxr\_: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WYSIWYG+Editor+Module ?  
21:36 <maxr\_> vmassol: thanks  
21:36 <vmassol> maxr\_: I've found a better doc: http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/WYSIWYGPluginInterface  
21:36 <vmassol> check the second one  
21:36 <vmassol> :)  
21:36 <vmassol> I've found it by googling, from this page: http://www.mail-archive.com/[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)/msg26081.html  
21:37 <maxr\_> vmassol: It's what I was looking for.

23:09 <MatthiasWegner> Hi there. I want to try xwiki on a server and want to try one from my provider. This server works with Parallels Plesk Panel. I never worked with it. You know how i can start xwiki in plesk?
